Table of Contents

Interface IDatabaseCleanupRepository

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Repositories
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Repository interface dedicated to low-level database maintenance, cleanup, integrity verification, and performance optimization tasks for the RSS reader SQLite database.

public interface IDatabaseCleanupRepository

Remarks

This repository handles operations that are not tied to specific business entities (like articles or feeds) but are essential for long-term database health, storage management, and performance.

Typical use cases:

  • Scheduled nightly/weekly cleanup of old articles
  • Post-import vacuum and reindexing after bulk sync
  • Integrity checks before/after major migrations or backups
  • Monitoring database size and statistics for alerts (e.g., storage nearly full)
  • Dry-run analysis before destructive cleanup operations

Important behavioral guidelines for implementations:

  • All methods are asynchronous and fully support CancellationToken.
  • Operations that modify data should be executed with progress reporting.
  • Long-running tasks (VACUUM, REINDEX) may lock the database — implementations should use WAL mode.
  • Results DTOs provide detailed feedback for logging/UI.

Methods

AnalyzeCleanupImpactAsync(DateTime, bool, bool, CancellationToken)

Simulates a cleanup operation and returns projected impact without modifying data.

Task<CleanupAnalysis> AnalyzeCleanupImpactAsync(DateTime cutoffDate, bool keepFavorites, bool keepUnread, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cutoffDate DateTime

Hypothetical cutoff date.

keepFavorites bool

Whether favorites would be preserved.

keepUnread bool

Whether unread would be preserved.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

Returns

Task<CleanupAnalysis>

Analysis result with projected deletion count, and estimated space savings.

CheckIntegrityAsync(CancellationToken)

Performs a full integrity check on the SQLite database.

Task<IntegrityCheckResult> CheckIntegrityAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

Returns

Task<IntegrityCheckResult>

Result object with overall status and any corruption/errors found.

DeleteOldArticlesAsync(DateTime, bool, bool, CancellationToken)

Deletes articles older than the specified cutoff date, with configurable protection for favorites and unread items.

Task<ArticleDeletionResult> DeleteOldArticlesAsync(DateTime cutoffDate, bool keepFavorites, bool keepUnread, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cutoffDate DateTime

Articles with PublicationDate < this date are candidates for deletion.

keepFavorites bool

If true, favorited articles are excluded from deletion.

keepUnread bool

If true, unread articles are excluded regardless of age.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

Returns

Task<ArticleDeletionResult>

A result object with deletion statistics.

Exceptions

ArgumentException

When cutoffDate is in the future.

GetAffectedArticlesDateRangeAsync(DateTime, bool, bool, CancellationToken)

Queries the date range of articles that would be affected by a cleanup operation.

Task<(DateTime? Oldest, DateTime? Newest)?> GetAffectedArticlesDateRangeAsync(DateTime cutoffDate, bool keepFavorites, bool keepUnread, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cutoffDate DateTime

Cutoff date for analysis.

keepFavorites bool

Exclude favorites?

keepUnread bool

Exclude unread?

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

Returns

Task<(DateTime? Oldest, DateTime? Newest)?>

Tuple with oldest and newest publication dates of affected articles (or null if none).
